overview_of_class: This course focuses on developing complex programs using the Java object-oriented language. The course is the first of two courses in object-oriented programing for the Information Systems major. The course begins with a quick introduction to the basics of the Java language: variables, conditionals, looping and user-defined methods. Students write programs that utilize methods, arrays and array lists and exception handling for solving problems. Information hiding, inheritance, polymorphism, aggregation and interfaces as principles of object-oriented programming will be introduced. This course includes interactive lectures and labs. Students will be required to complete multiple computer programs and quizzes. A final assignment is required for students to illustrate their understanding of all programming topics covered in the course.
name: Introduction to Object-Oriented Programming
title: SCS CIS 212-CN-14 Introduction to Object-Oriented Programming

Students write programs that utilize methods, arrays and array lists and exception handling for solving problems. Information hiding, inheritance, polymorphism, aggregation and interfaces as principles of object-oriented programming will be introduced. This course includes interactive lectures and labs. Students will be required to complete multiple computer programs and quizzes. A final assignment is required for students to illustrate their understanding of all programming topics covered in the course.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: May not be audited or taken P/N. Information Systems majors should enroll in this introductory course; CIS 110-CN Introduction to Computer Programming is for non-majors only.

descriptions.value:
